attachments.title: Penrose: From Mathematical Notation to Beautiful Diagrams
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Penrose: From Mathematical Notation to Beautiful Diagrams
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OyD4LIv2PDc?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: "holy crap this stuff is super cool" project involving term rewriting..

elements.text: "holy crap this stuff is super cool" project involving term rewriting..

text: Wow!! I love this. I enjoyed this video and the content more than I thought I would from the title alone. Thanks for sharing

elements.text: Wow!! I love this. I enjoyed this video and the content more than I thought I would from the title alone. Thanks for sharing

text: yeah Haskell people are good at taking a hugely complex problem and saying "to solve this problem you need a language to express all the families of problems that are related" and BOOM cool stuff comes out

elements.text: yeah Haskell people are good at taking a hugely complex problem and saying "to solve this problem you need a language to express all the families of problems that are related" and BOOM cool stuff comes out

text: Somehow I missed that it was in Haskell. But wow yeah powerful stuff solving it from a language standpoint and then making this complete product out of it

elements.text: Somehow I missed that it was in Haskell. But wow yeah powerful stuff solving it from a language standpoint and then making this complete product out of it

text: Look at how they optimized those beautiful looking hyperbolic and spherical geometry diagrams! Wow!! Near 12:55. And that it's fully customizable to other math domains and a wide range of styles too

elements.text: Look at how they optimized those beautiful looking hyperbolic and spherical geometry diagrams! Wow!! Near 12:55. And that it's fully customizable to other math domains and a wide range of styles too

text: I can't wait to see how this is used more in the future. Maybe even in educational YouTube videos or math textbooks

elements.text: I can't wait to see how this is used more in the future. Maybe even in educational YouTube videos or math textbooks

text: Unfortunately they're likely to keep it closed source, but most of the tooling can probs be done in Julia! We have the MacroTools for the DSL, dispatch for the styles, and solvers diagram tuning, and Makie for plotting.

elements.text: Unfortunately they're likely to keep it closed source, but most of the tooling can probs be done in Julia! We have the MacroTools for the DSL, dispatch for the styles, and solvers diagram tuning, and Makie for plotting.

text: Only gotta draw the owl now :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

elements.text: Only gotta draw the owl now
